lexUnit.definition: An impression that a person has of something or someone

For many , the image of Greek music and dance is inexorably linked to the film `` Zorba the Greek . ''
The Rangers ' battles with Texas border Mexicans helped create the image of the fearless fighters .
How can you tell if Clinton is going to do a mea culpa ? My guess : Watch Monica 's image .
In a generalization of our image of a self - constructing biosphere , the universe may construct itself to be as complex and diverse as possible .

The result is a modern - day `` wild West '' meshed with everyday life , where image is reality , poverty clashes with wealth , and fame is acquired overnight â€” all publicized to the hilt around the globe .
Why should Bush get credit for keeping his hands clean and preserving his above - the - fray image if , as Forbes alleges , he has achieved this by letting the RLC do his dirty work ?
This is also the public image so carefully cultivated for them by endangered - species activists .
NRA leaders believe the patriarchal Heston will polish the gun lobby 's lousy public image while galvanizing its red - meat - and - gunpowder members .
But by hiring a PR firm to manage his image , wooing reporters with occasional jokes , and bonding with Prime Minister Tony Blair , Charles has staged an astounding revival .
The AMA , meanwhile , will spend the next few months ( or years ) trying to repair its image .
Yet no Clinton administration figure depends more on image than the attorney general , and none has relied so much on words and symbols as a substitute for action .

The Times does what it can to unbuff the image , running a picture of Heston that seems to show him either a ) getting a hit off the gunpowder fumes on his fingertips , b ) blowing kisses or c ) throwing up .

Rockefeller who , in his later years , consulted a public-relations firm and `` took to giving out dimes to children in the street in order to soften his image as a hard - hearted businessman . ''
He felt the long rhinestone cigarette holder undercut his butch image .
'' Nature , red in tooth and claw '' remains the dominant image of the animal world .
So the shift in the image of Gates has been an interesting one for me to watch .

I personally always thought it was a risk to pin the image of Microsoft on just one man -- at AOL , for example , there was a conscious effort to develop other `` characters , '' for lack of a better word .

While I did not attend the trial -- I was lucky to be able to read your highly amusing and informative dispatches , several of which made me spit up my lunch laughing -- it certainly seemed as if the image of Bill Gates took a beating and the insular culture of Microsoft did not look so good .
